Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir Domingos José de Almeida,

It was a great pleasure for me to receive the highly esteemed letter of Your Excellency dated June 21 of this year, and, by virtue of the request therein, I hereby send, by copy, the responses given by the Government of the Rio-Grandense Republic and by its Generals David Canabarro and João Antônio da Silveira on the occasion of the invitation made by the Baron of Caxias to propose the bases upon which the cessation of the war that was then ongoing against the Empire could be established. 

Regarding the peoples of Japeju and São Tomé, my father-in-law says they belong to the Missions to the west of Uruguay, and are located on the right bank of this river. I hope that, in this way, the requirement of Your Excellency will be satisfied.

Your Excellency

My son Antônio Pedroso de Albuquerque is the bearer of this letter; he proceeds to São Paulo to finalize his law degree, and since it is difficult to meet with Your Excellency

Your Excellency

José Pedroso de Albuquerque.

Alegrete, September 16, 1860

From Senhor José Pedroso de Albuquerque.

Received on September 26, 1860.

Answered on September 26, 1860.
